name: 語言習得專題研究
description: This course takes an ecological perspective on language and language acquisition, focusing on some of the learning mechanisms that might be shared by both first and second language learning. One such mechanism will be closely examined: statistical learning. Possibilities of re-activating this mechanism for second language learning will be discussed in the class.
goals: Understand and appreciate the psychological perspective on language acquisition;
Explore and understand the learning mechanisms that infants and adults are equipped with for learning languages, first or second;
Develop a critical view of language learning theories;
Be able to put the new theory to practice ;
syllabus:
【授課方式：16+2週】

授課16週

Starting from the second week, the class will read and discuss two research articles per week, and each student shall practice writing a critical summary of the articles at the end of the class each week.

2週彈性教學

Students shall learn to run an experiment on statistical learning.
